result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren P. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - stayed
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-66

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-81, 15CF-66, 15CM-73 and 15CF-117.

1:46 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
15CF-66: State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1 to misdemeanor possession of THC, enhancer. 6 month jail, imposed/stayed, probation for 24 months, AODA and comply, abs sob as to alcohol and controlled substances other than prescribed medications, obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, pay costs. Defendant will plead to this amended count. Defendant will also plead to Count 2, BAC: .147, 23 day jail sentence, $1,568.00, $33.33, 14 Mo revocation, 14 Mo IID, DOT assessment. Counts 3 and 4 would be dismissed and read in.

15CF-81: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.
Count 1 and Count 3: 6 mo jail on each, imposed/stayed, concurrent to one another, consecutive to any other sentence, probation 24 months, same conditions, costs, DNA surcharge.  Count 4: 25 day jail sentence consecutive to 15CF-66.

15CM-73: Defendant will plead to single count as charged. State recommends 90 day jail sentence, imposed/stayed, consecutive to any other sentence, probation for 24 months, same general conditions, costs.

15CF-117: State recommends this case be dismissed and read in

Atty Sheets concurs.
Atty Sheets has received a copy of the amended information.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-66: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-66: Count 2 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 3 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 4 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-73: Count 1 NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-66: Count 1: 961.41(3g)(3)   939.62(1)(a)
15CF-66: Count 2: 346.63(1)(a)  Defendant ackknowledges previous conviction

15CF-81: Count 4: 943.44(1)(b)
15CM-73: Count 1:  961.573(1)   939.62(1)(a)
15CF-117: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. $500 cash bond on 15CF-117 to be applied to fines/costs. $500 cash bond in 15CF-81 to be applied to fines/costs.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. Defendant works at Golden County Foods. Atty Sheets requests electronic monitoring.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties.
